summary.para: Performs the following operation for each element of InputTensor, placing the result into the corresponding element of OutputTensor. This operator clamps (or limits) every element in the input within the closed interval [Min, Max].
Where max(a,b) returns the larger of the two values, and min(a,b) returns the smaller of the two values a,b.
This operator supports in-place execution, meaning that OutputTensor is permitted to alias InputTensor during binding.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_CLIP1_OPERATOR_DESC.InputTensor
member.summary: The input tensor to read from.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_CLIP1_OPERATOR_DESC.OutputTensor
member.summary: The output tensor to write the results to.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_CLIP1_OPERATOR_DESC.ScaleBias
member.summary: An optional scale and bias to apply to the input. If present, this has the effect of applying the function g(x) = x * scale + bias to each input element prior to computing this operator.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_CLIP1_OPERATOR_DESC.MinMaxDataType
member.summary: The data type of the Min and Max members, which must match OutputTensor.DataType.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_CLIP1_OPERATOR_DESC.Min
member.summary: The minimum value, below which the operator replaces the value with Min. MinMaxDataType determines how to interpret the field.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_CLIP1_OPERATOR_DESC.Max
member.summary: The maximum value, above which the operator replaces the value with Max. MinMaxDataType determines how to interpret the field.
